main event: On 24 May 1958, a sighting of an oval red object, the size of a pen, was reported in San Diego, California. The object exhibited very rapid movements, coming from the West and moving into the North.
interesting points: The object had very radical movement patterns., The sighting lasted for approximately 10 to 12 minutes., A son witnessed the object with his family from their window., The balloon schedules indicated a balloon was supposed to be launched at the same time of the sighting., The observer was deemed very reliable and had no explanation for the object.
witness description: Reported by a civilian, Mr. Karvey Mesa, age 44, who works at Convair Astronautics.
